title: Running with God
quoted_scripture: "But when you pray, go into your room, close your door and pray to your Father, who is unseen. Then your Father who sees what is done in secret will reward you."
body_text:
I am a runner and an unconventional prayer warrior.

Over the past 40 years, I have stepped out of my home and greeted the day with the step-by-step rhythm of my feet. Some folks have asked me if I run with headphones. Negative to that.  How would I be able to have my daily conversations with God if I had these on?

The outdoors morning is my "room" and I am indeed thankful that God knows me in such a way that He provides me with this quiet time.
That's not a place where most people would define a prayer setting.

My "God chats" have run (excuse the pun) from praying for family members or friends needs to asking for guidance and direction.  God is always listening as the dawn is breaking around me. Sometimes answers and results come quickly: while others I still wait for, knowing that I may never have a resolution in my lifetime.

Your prayer setting is as unique to you as God has made you unique. Where is your room?
prayer: Lord, I am thankful for the time and the place that You have given me to spend with You.
